intro: Specklinia xerophila, commonly known as the Xerophyte fern, is a rare and unique species belonging to the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and possesses specialized adaptations for surviving in arid environments. The plant features small, leathery leaves that reduce water loss and are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Its rhizomes are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it endure long dry periods. Specklinia xerophila is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
